main event: In 1954, a luminous circular object appeared and disappeared several times over Stavern, Norway. It remained stationary for seven minutes before disappearing at a speed many times that of sound.
interesting points: The object was observed for a duration of 55 minutes, providing a substantial amount of data.
It was described as circular with a dark lower part and a luminous aluminum upper part.
The object disappeared at a speed many times that of sound, indicating extremely high velocity.
The report mentions it as a second-hand account, suggesting multiple witnesses or official documentation.
The origin of the report is labeled as 'The Flying Saucer Question Almost Cleared Up,' implying an attempt to explain the sighting.
witnesses: D Air-Visual, 50 officers and men at Stavern, Norway
